active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a team, debate whether storing any sensitive files under the web root is ever justifiable, using real-world examples like past breaches (e.g., Equifax). Categorize causes of file disclosure (e.g., path traversal vs. misconfigurations) and vote on the most preventable one. Justify positions with references to OWASP or NIST standards.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in university-level pedagogy (Bloom's Taxonomy, active learning). Topic: File Disclosure Vulnerabilities (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 008_Application Security > Web 008_Application Security > 010_File Handling and Upload Security > File Download Security > File Disclosure Vulnerabilities). Incorporate: - Learning Objectives: [INSERT learning_objectives JSON ARRAY HERE] - Active Learning: Use elements to inspire questions (e.g., debate mitigations, peer-teach vectors, solve OWASP scenarios). - Scaffolding Layers: [INSERT scaffolding_layers JSON OBJECT HERE] - Research Context: File disclosure = unauthorized file access (configs, source, PII) via path traversal (../), IDOR, misconfigs. Mitigations: validation, no webroot storage, NIST SP 800-216 for testing. Generate 25 flashcards following the EXACT Flashcard Schema: [INSERT flashcard_schema JSON OBJECT HERE]. Output ONLY a JSON array of flashcards, each as an object: {"front": {"question": "...", "options": {"A": "...", "B": "...", "C": "...", "D": "..."}}, "back": {"correct_answer": "A: Full answer", "explanation": "...", "blooms_level": "...", "scaffolding_layer": "...", "references": "..."}}. Ensure completeness (NIST, OWASP sources), pedagogy (progressive Bloom's), and distractors per protocol. High-quality, exam-ready.
